body:
str.count(a) is the best solution to count a single character in a string. But if you need to count more characters than one you would have to read the string as many times as characters you want to count.

A better approach for this job would be:

from collections import defaultdict

string = 'Mary had a little lamb'
chars = defaultdict(int)

for char in string:
    chars[char] += 1

So you'll have a dict that returns the number of ocurrences of every letter in the string and 0 if it isn't present.

>>>chars['a']
4
>>>chars['x']
0
title: Count occurrence of a character in a string
